speaker: Deep Catacombs
lines: Nich√©s hold clay jars labeled in a script that never learned to die.
Footfalls count in pairs until they remember you are odd.
An alcove houses a saint made of opinions; its smile forgives and forgets.
A tide of cool air pushes at your knees like a cat that won't be seen.
Bone dust takes prints like snow and erases as it pleases.
Somewhere a gear turns once in a century and you catch it in the act.
A voice behind you asks if you kept the salt. It is your voice. It is not behind you.
A shadow separates from the wall to see if it prefers being yours.

choices.text: Stand and let it move first.
Speak a name you learned in the library.
